glsa.title: GnuPG: Arbitrary Code Execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in GnuPG, which can lead to arbitrary code execution.

background.p: The GNU Privacy Guard, GnuPG, is a free replacement for the PGP suite of cryptographic software.

description.p: A vulnerability has been discovered in GnuPG's armor parser.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to process a specially crafted signature file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary commands with the privileges of the process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GnuPG users should upgrade to the latest version:
